notes: The Peugeot 106 and Citroen Saxo are twins. Suspension, brakes (VTS/GTI), and engines interchange. The later Citroen C2 VTS shares parts with the Peugeot 206 GTI. Rear beams are a common failure point but interchange between similar models.

The F4R 2.0L engine is found in many Renaults. The high-performance RS versions use different heads/intakes, but the blocks are often shared. You can use a Scenic or Laguna block to build a high-compression Clio RS engine.

The 1.6L Turbo 'Prince' engine (N14/N18 in Mini terms, THP in PSA terms) is shared. High-pressure fuel pumps (HPFP), turbos, and timing chain kits are often identical but cheaper when bought in a Peugeot/Citroen box instead of a BMW/Mini box.
The Volvo 400 series used Renault engines. The B18FT (Volvo 1.7 Turbo) is based on the Renault F-series architecture. Some parts interchange with the Renault 5 GT Turbo and Clio engines.
